title: 114_hr914
content: Improvement of Federal Recovery Coordinator Program. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will provide collaborative recovery coordinator training at a qualified nursing or medical school to lead evidence review and consensus conference for developing evidence-based guidelines and care coordination modules. The school will also develop software compatible with VA systems for recovery coordination. The qualified nursing or medical school is designated to lead a consensus conference on evidence-based care coordination and develop care coordination software. Authorization of appropriations is set at $1,200,000 for these initiatives. The qualified nursing or medical school is authorized to train 45 recovery coordinators with an authorization of $500,000 for each fiscal year from 2016 to 2018. SEC. 2. JOINT OPERATION OF FEDERAL RECOVERY COORDINATION PROGRAM. The Federal Recovery Coordination Program is jointly operated by the Secretaries of Defense and Veterans Affairs to assist members of the Armed Forces with severe injuries or illnesses who are unlikely to return to active duty. The Federal Recovery Coordination Program, operated by the Secretaries of Defense and Veterans Affairs, assists members with severe injuries or illnesses in transitioning to civilian life. Referrals must be made early, and Federal Government agencies provide a Federal Recovery Coordinator. The Federal Recovery Coordinator Program, operated by the Secretaries of Defense and Veterans Affairs, assists members and veterans in transitioning to civilian life by providing information, coordination, and cooperation necessary for efficient recovery, transition, and reintegration. The Coordinator acts as a liaison between members, veterans, and care providers, working closely with case and care management. The Secretaries of Defense and Veterans Affairs will work closely with case and care-management programs to assist members and veterans. They are required to jointly develop a plan, enter into a memorandum of understanding, and submit a report to congressional committees within specific timeframes. The Secretaries of Defense and Veterans Affairs will collaborate on a plan to assist members and veterans, submitting a report to congressional committees. The term "appropriate congressional committees" refers to the Committees on Armed Services and Veterans' Affairs of the House and Senate.
